name: Richard Nagy
cookieBanner.title: This website uses cookies
cookieBanner.subTitle: I use cookies (and similar technoligies) to enhance your browsing experience, serve personalized content, and analyze my traffic. By clicking "Accept All", you consent to my use of cookies.
consent.description: Stores that you already interacted with the cookie consent banner.
functionList: Software engineer, technology enthusiast, hobby economist
quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
intro.p1: I'm a profitient software engineer, working as a full-stack web application developer. My mission is to help companies uncage the potential of technology.
intro.p2: I started professional programming as a student at Obuda University. In the third semester I got my first internship position where I started learning web application development. I wrote my thesis on cross-platform mobile application development, then graduated in 2018. Since then I work full time as a software engineer in different roles.
intro.p3: During my career I worked on various projects like e-commerce platform and project management tools mainly using Microsoft® technologies. I gathered experience in agile methodologies and Test Driven Development as well.
intro.p4: At my leisure I'm happy to learn about the economics, take photos and play video games.
dobo: Dobó Katalin High School of Esztergom
ms.quantDev.desc: My responsibility is to support the work of bond traders and desk strats at Morgan Stanley with different reports that help them making trading and risk management decisions. The team I’m a member of works on the development and operation of a software package, that makes it possible, to send automated reports to traders in New York, London, and Tokyo on a daily basis. During this period, I learned some new programing languages and technologies (e.g.: Python, q/KDB), and I also gained knowledge in economics and trading.
avon.devOps.desc: As a DevOps Engineer I worked on the support and operations of the My Avon Store e-commerce platform. I also participated in the 7/24 On-Call Support.
avon.fullStack.desc: As part of the My Avon Store Development Team, I worked on the development of Avon's e-commerce platform, using .NET C#, Node.JS, MS SQL, MongoDB and Angular.
abesse.fullStack.desc: In the course of my work, I was involved in the development and operation of custom software for various enterprises. The methodology of the work varied from project to project; I also participated in waterfall model development, but mostly worked on agile projects. Initially, I worked on the development of a management tool to support the internal processes of a domestic pharmaceutical company, later my task was to optimize and further develop the project management software of an international energy company. I  worked  in  a  DevOps  team  all  the  time,  so  I  managed  to  gain  experience  not  only  in development, but also in operation and support tasks.
ht.fullStack.desc: My main job was to participate in the development of a customer relationship management (CRM) software. The methodology of the work was Scrum / Agile. During my work, I had the opportunity to participate in several “greenfield” projects. For example, I worked on the project and time management software of a U.S public utilities company, and I also participated in the development of a digital tool for the OBDK (National Center  for  Patients,  Care,  Children’s  Rights,  and  Documentation)  to  collect  mandatory monthly and annual reports from health care facilities. I also had a task to develop a mobile application for HyperTeam CRM, during which I had the good fortune to get to know the Xamarin platform.
